results.title: Yentl
results.creator_credit: Barbra Streisand, Rusty Lemorande, Barwood Films, United Artists Corporation and Ladbroke Entertainment
results.brief_description: Based on the short story “Yentl, the Yeshiva boy” by Isaac Bashevis Singer, this is the poignant tale of a young European Jewish woman (Barbara Streisand), circa 1904, who disguises herself as a boy in order to pursue her passion for studying holy scripture, an endeavour restricted exclusively to men in orthodox Jewish culture. As the education of women is prohibited in her society, she must keep her identity a secret. The strangely deceptive world this creates poses many challenges for this intrepid character who, in overcoming them, proves that nothing is impossible. The making of this modern classic was a milestone, not only for its main creative force, the legendary Streisand, but for motion picture history. “Yentl” marked the first time that a woman had produced, co-written, directed and starred in a major feature film.

constellations_other.name: What's in a name?
constellations_other.description: Pakeezah (1972) star Meena Kumari was not just The Tragedy Queen of Hindi film – she was also a poet, writing under the pseudonym Naaz. From famous families to stage names to gendered disguises, this constellation explores how women onscreen have adopted different names and identities to facilitate their ambition.

results.title: Sergeant York
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks, Hal B. Wallis, Jesse L Lasky and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: He was a pacifist, turned patriot; a backwoods farmboy and ace Turkey Shoot champ who decided there are some things worth fighting for. Sergeant Alvin C. York became the renowned hero of World War I, capturing 132 German soldiers during the savage fighting in the Argonne. York insisted that if a film was to be made of his life, he wanted Gary Cooper only to play his character. This performance earned Cooper an Oscar. Under the direction of Howard Hawks, and with a cast that included Walter Brennan and Joan Leslie, this film will remain an all time classic.

results.title: Quigley
results.creator_credit: Simon Wincer, Alex Rose, Stanley O'Toole and Pathe Entertainment
results.brief_description: Tom Selleck stars as Matthew Quigley, an American hired gun who answers a “Help Wanted” ad and finds himself in Australia. Alan Rickman plays the evil, British cattle rancher who hires Quigley. Quigley refuses the job and is left stranded in the outback with a crazy woman called Cora (Laura San Giacomo). Essentially a western in an outback setting, the film also features Chris Haywood, Tony Bonner and Ben Mendelson.

results.title: The Producers
results.creator_credit: Mel Brooks, Sidney Glazier, Crossbow and Springtime
results.brief_description: Considered one of Mel Brook’s funniest films, this hilarious farce follows an attempted swindle by a con artist (Zero Mostel) and his accountant (Gene Wilder) who attempt to stage a Broadway flop only to have it backfire. This film has achieved cult status and is known for musical interlude “Springtime for Hitler”. Wilder received an Oscar nomination for his role in this zany classic. The phony play was later actually produced by Alan Johnson.

results.title: Rebecca of Sunnybrook Farm
results.creator_credit: Allan Dwan, Darryl F. Zanuck and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “The Shirley Temple collection”.
Shirley Temple sings, dances and charms her way into everyone’s hearts in this acclaimed version of the Kate Douglas Wiggins story. When orphan Rebecca, (Shirley Temple), auditions for a radio show and doesn’t get the job, her stepfather, (William Demarest), takes her to live with Aunt Miranda, (Helen Westley), owner of Sunnybrook Farm. However, the show’s talent agent, (Randolph Scott), was prepared to hire Rebecca and begins to search frantically for the missing youngster - unaware the pint-sized radio star lives next door! This is a colourised version of the original black and white film.

results.title: Twelve o'clock high
results.creator_credit: Henry King, Darryl F. Zanuck and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: Featuring authentic aerial battle film, this gritty World War 2 action film emphasises the heroic but perilious face of war. Convinced that an air force commander is at breaking point, Brigadier General Savage takes over the struggling bomber troop. He uses strict disciplinary tactics, despite his kind and understanding nature, to revitalise a demoralised troop. At first resentful and rebellious, the flyers learn to gradually respect Savage and to perform as expected. Eventually the stress of command begins to take its toll on Savage, until he too faces breaking point. Starring Gregory Peck, Dean Jagger, Hugh Marlowe, Gary Merrill and Millard Mitchell.

results.title: The Merry widow
results.brief_description: Jeanette MacDonald is Sonia, a bubbly widow who owns over half the property of the tiny European country of Marshovia. When she relocates to glittery Paris, suave ladies’ man Captain Danilo, (Maurice Chevalier), pursues her. His mission: avert his homeland’s financial ruin by bringing Sonia back on the wings of love. A frothy high-spirited gem based on Frank Lehar’s operetta with the magical Lubitsch touch of wit and style.

results.title: March of the wooden soldiers = Babes in Toyland
results.creator_credit: Gus Meins, Charles Rogers, Hal Roach and Federal Films
results.brief_description: Laurel and Hardy are well-meaning toymakers who muddle an order for Santa. Instead on making one 600 foot high soldier, they make one hundred six-foot soldiers instead. The toy army comes in handy when Barnaby and his furry Bogeymen invade Toyland. The boys end up as heroes as they save Widow Peep’s daughter Bo. Originally known as “Babes in Toyland”, the film was heavily censored as it was considered too scary for children, and it was seldom seen after the Disney remake of 1963. Nevertheless, it remained one of Laurel and Hardy’s best films and it was the personal favourite of Hardy.

results.title: Journey to the center of the earth
results.creator_credit: Henry Levin, Charles Brackett and Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation
results.brief_description: The accent is on fun and fantasy in this version of Jules Verne’s classic subterranean adventure. With spectacular visuals as a backdrop, the story centres on an expedition led by Professor Lindenbrook (James Mason) into the earth’s core. He is accompanied by his star student (Pat Boone) and a rival’s widow (Arlene Dahl). They encounter many dangers and wonders, including giant prehistoric reptiles and a lost city.

results.title: Yankee doodle dandy
results.creator_credit: Michael Curtiz, William Cagney and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: George B. Cohan, born on the 4th of July, became one of Broadway’s legendary composers. Cohan’s prolific career spanned 55 years where he wrote 35 plays and 500 songs including “Harrigan”, “Give my regards to Broadway”, and of course “Yankee Doodle Dandy.” This is an exuberant song and dance production starring James Cagney, with his typical flair, in the title role. This film premiered in 1942 and was a salute to American patriotism and the ‘Grand old flag’, yet time has not dulled its freshness and energy.
